intro: Hypseocharis pilgeri, commonly known as the Pilger's hypseocharis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the spring and early summer. Hypseocharis pilgeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its alpine habitat.
